title: U.S. consumer Christmas spending habits 2011 to 2013
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 5 different Responses for 3 groups 2011, 2012, and 2013 that are presented on the X-axis.
In Response Spend the same as last Christmas, 2013 had the highest Share of respondents 49.0 among the 3 groups and in Do not celebrate Christmas, 2011 had the lowest Share of respondents 3.0.
Among all the Responses, 2011 had the highest Share of respondents in Response Spend the same as last Christmas and lowest Share of respondents in Response Do not celebrate Christmas.

The maximum Share of respondents for 2011 that was found in Response Spend the same as last Christmas was 14.0 times larger than the minimum Share of respondents observed in Response Do not celebrate Christmas.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 5 different Responses for 3 groups 2011, 2012, and 2013 that are presented on the X-axis.
In Response Spend the same as last Christmas, 2013 had the highest Share of respondents 49.0 among the 3 groups and in Do not celebrate Christmas, 2011 had the lowest Share of respondents 3.0.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 5 different Responses for 3 groups 2011, 2012, and 2013 that are presented on the X-axis.
In Response Spend the same as last Christmas, 2013 had the highest Share of respondents 49.0 among the 3 groups and in Do not celebrate Christmas, 2011 had the lowest Share of respondents 3.0.
Among all the Responses, 2011 had the highest Share of respondents in Response Spend the same as last Christmas and lowest Share of respondents in Response Do not celebrate Christmas.

The maximum Share of respondents for 2011 that was found in Response Spend the same as last Christmas was 14.0 times larger than the minimum Share of respondents observed in Response Do not celebrate Christmas.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 5 different Responses for 3 groups 2011, 2012, and 2013 that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 3 groups, 2013 had the highest Share of respondents in Response Spend the same as last Christmas and 2011 had the lowest Share of respondents in Response Do not celebrate Christmas.
In Response Spend the same as last Christmas, 2011 had the maximum Share of respondents and it saw the lowest in Response Do not celebrate Christmas out of all 5 Responses.

The maximum Share of respondents for 2011 that was found in Response Spend the same as last Christmas was 14.0 times larger than the minimum Share of respondents observed in Response Do not celebrate Christmas.
Among the groups, 2012 had the biggest difference in Share of respondents. Where the maximum Share of respondents was 11.75 times larger than the minimum Share of respondents.

2013 had the maximum Share of respondents out of all 3 groups in Response Spend the same as last Christmas followed by 2013 in Spend the same as last Christmas, and the minimum Share of respondents is found for 2011 in Do not celebrate Christmas.
Averaging all 3 groups 2011, 2012, and 2013, the Response Spend the same as last Christmas is the maximum Share of respondents and Do not celebrate Christmas is the minimum Share of respondents.

data.Response: Spend the same as last Christmas
